page.title: 03PRESTON AS A RAIL CENTRE
page.content: Preston has a main line station and is situated in the middle of the London to Glasgow mainline. Inter_City trains run every hour to and from London. It is a chief place for changing trains for Blackpool, Manchester, Liverpool, Barrow, Leeds, Blackburn and Colne. The main traffic involves passenger trains running for businessmen, holidaymakers and day trippers. The main freight traffic is steel, coal, cement, raw materials and general mixed freight. Oil trains pass through Preston Docks on the freight only spur from the station. There is a large parcels depot at Preston as it is a key distribution centre for the country. It is also a very important centre for postal traffic.
